notableFeatures: Outer pool connected to the sea
Steel gates for sea creature passage

keyEvents.title: Arlong Park Introduction
keyEvents.description: Arlong Park is revealed as the headquarters of the Arlong Pirates, an imposing eight-story fortress on the Conomi Islands.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of the primary setting for the Arlong Park Arc.

keyEvents.title: Site of Arlong-Nezumi Bribery
keyEvents.description: Captain Nezumi meets with Arlong at Arlong Park to receive bribe money.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Arlong Park as the center of Arlong's corrupt operations.

keyEvents.title: Zoro's Capture at Arlong Park
keyEvents.description: Zoro is captured and brought to Arlong Park for interrogation.
keyEvents.significance: Arlong Park becomes the site of confrontation between the Straw Hats and Arlong.

culturalSignificance.description: Arlong Park was deliberately designed to resemble Sabaody Park, a location fish-men admired as children but were forbidden from entering due to discrimination. This makes it a symbol of both Arlong's resentment and his desire for fish-man superiority.
culturalSignificance.symbolism: Represents the inverted power structure Arlong seeks to create, where fish-men rule over humans.
culturalSignificance.historicalContext: Established approximately a decade before the Arlong Park Arc when Arlong arrived at the Conomi Islands.

reveals.information: Headquarters of the Arlong Pirates and center of their operations in the East Blue
Modeled after Sabaody Park, a symbol of fish-man exclusion turned into a fortress of supremacy
Contains weapon room, map room where Nami works, and pool connected to the sea

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Approach Conomi Islands
keyEvents.description: Zoro, Johnny, and Usopp arrive at the Conomi Islands pursuing Nami.
keyEvents.significance: The crew arrives at the setting for the Arlong Park Arc.

culturalSignificance.description: A peaceful agricultural region transformed into a terrorized territory under Arlong's decade-long rule. Villages must pay monthly tributes to survive, with those unable to pay facing destruction.
culturalSignificance.symbolism: Represents the corruption of peace and prosperity by tyranny and oppression.
culturalSignificance.historicalContext: Fell under Arlong's control approximately ten years before the arc.

controlHistory.methodOfControl: Extortion through monthly tribute system backed by violence

reveals.information: Under Arlong's control with a tribute system extracting money from all villages
Archipelago in northwestern East Blue with at least twenty communities

keyEvents.title: Cocoyasi Village Introduction
keyEvents.description: Nojiko is shown in Cocoyasi Village, establishing it as Nami's home village.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of Nami's home village, crucial to understanding her backstory.

culturalSignificance.description: Nami's home village where she and Nojiko were raised by their adoptive mother Bell-mère. The village has suffered under Arlong's rule but maintains its community despite the oppression.
culturalSignificance.symbolism: Represents home, family, and the personal stakes driving Nami's actions.
culturalSignificance.historicalContext: Has been under Arlong's control for approximately ten years.

controlHistory.methodOfControl: Tribute system and threat of violence

reveals.information: Nami's home village where she was raised

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Gosa Village Destruction
keyEvents.description: Johnny and Usopp discover Gosa Village completely destroyed, with every building flipped upside down by Arlong's forces.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the brutal reality of Arlong's rule and his willingness to destroy entire villages.

culturalSignificance.description: Gosa Village serves as a stark example of what happens to villages that cannot pay Arlong's tribute. The complete destruction, with buildings literally overturned, creates a disturbing image of Arlong's power and cruelty.
culturalSignificance.symbolism: The upside-down buildings symbolize the inverted moral order under Arlong's rule and the complete devastation of community.
culturalSignificance.historicalContext: Destroyed 2-3 weeks before the Straw Hats' arrival for failing to pay the monthly tribute.

reveals.information: Completely destroyed by Arlong's sea monster Momoo for failure to pay tribute
Multiple villagers killed including Chabo's father
Destroyed 2-3 weeks before the Straw Hats' arrival
